data.event: The first European settler in the area was John Sheddon Adam in 1843, but settlement did not occur in larger numbers until the late 1850s, with the completion of Great North Road.
Expansion was rapid, with churches, stores and a public hall built by 1867.
With a railway connection to the settlement in 1880, the rate of settlement increased further.
Te Whau became Avondale District on 5 June 1882, although the old name survives in the Whau River, an estuarial arm of the Waitemata Harbour, which runs along the western edge of the suburb.
